page.title: 19SOUTHFIELD SCHOOL
page.content: Southfield School is the only secondary school in this area.It is a comprehensive school taking pupils from the age of 11. It is a new school having being formed as a result of re-organisation of secondary schools in West Cumbria in 1984. Infact it is one of three secondary schools in Workington,one of which is a Roman Catholic school. The school has over 1000 pupils and is housed on a split site made up of two former schools in the area.The two buildings are not far apart,(approximately 400m),and the upper school site is situated right next to the Moorclose leisure centre. Southfield School shares a sixth form with Stainburn School and eventually the sixth form will have their own seperate building.
